page.title: 16Drama and Choir in Ditchling
page.content: The Ditchling Players regularly perform two plays a year in the excel_ lently equipped Village Hall and assist with a traditional pageant put on every 10 years. The standard of acting and production generally is acknowledged to be very high and can be attributed in part to the interest taken by professionals connected with the Village, notably the Sinden family and Dame Vera Lynne (the Forces' Sweetheart). Recent productions have included "The Crucible" by Arthur Miller and "Ten Times Table" by Alan Ayckbourn. The Ditchling Choral Society has a membership of over 100. Janet Canetty_ Clarke is their Director of Music and Conductor and in l986 they plan to perform Walton's "Belshazzar's Feast" and Haydn's "Creation".
